page.title: 14FIELD NAMES in Melton Ross
page.content:
From 1607 all land in Melton Ross, except the Glebe, has been in the control of one family. From 1607 to 1752 it was that of the Dukes of Rutland.In 1752 Charles Anderson Pelham (who later became the first Lord Yarborough) purchased the parish The Yarborough family remain as land- owners, the land is farmed by tenant farmers.The Melton Ross tithe award of 1849 shows the parish contained 60 named fields.(Average size 28 acres) A sample of these are set out below :-
Catta Home close Top dunnace Prieste Stone pit walk Gallow close Hall garth Church plat Tonmy thornham
By 1970 only 4 of these had been amal- gamated.Some names have been revised . Priests is now Priestley,Friar bob, Friar bole & Wood plat now Wold plat.
